radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis in the visualized lung bases, no pleural effusion, normal liver, patent portal veins, scattered punctate calcified granulomata in the spleen, normal gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, prompt excretion of IV contrast without hydronephrosis or hydroureter, normal stomach, duodenum, and loops of small bowel, no free air, fluid, or lymphadenopathy in the intra-abdominal cavity. The prominent appendix measures 7 mm in diameter with equivocal periappendiceal fat stranding and tiny mesenteric nodes in the right lower quadrant. The colon is normal and the urinary bladder is normally distended without focal abnormalities.
